isis.stitle: VT-365 Diesel Engine Diagnostics (2002) - ENGINE SYSTEMS - Engine Identification - Emission Labels

svcproc.title: Emission Labels
svcproc.para: Two emission labels are issued for the International® VT 365 diesel engine

item.para: U.S. Federal Family Emission Limits Label

figure.caption: Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) emission label (50 state)

svcproc.para: The Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) Emission Label (shown above) or a Low Emission Vehicle (LEV) label (not shown) is on the right valve cover. Both labels have a similar design but different colors. Each engine will have one or the other, depending on engine application. Both EPA labels include the following:

item.para: Year the engine was certified to meet government EPA emission standards

figure.caption: U.S. Federal Family Emission Limits label

svcproc.para: Some engines may have the U.S. Federal Family Emission Limits Label on the right valve cover. This label identifies the engine family and emission limits established by the manufacturer and certified by the EPA.
The following engine accessories may have manufacturer's labels or identification plates:

item.para: Air compressor (for brake or suspension system )

svcproc.para: Labels or identification plates include information and specifications helpful to vehicle operators and technicians.
